script.name: Download/Update Java
script.description: Downloads and installs Java binaries from Adoptium
script.code:
# UPDATE-JAVA
# This script is also run on After Created and After Reinstall. If you need to make any changes, make them in this script.
import clr
clr.AddReference('System.IO')
clr.AddReference('System.IO.Compression.ZipFile')
clr.AddReference("System")
clr.AddReference("TCAdmin.SDK")
clr.AddReference("System.Net.Http")   # <-- required for HttpClient types

from datetime import datetime
from System.Net.Http import HttpClient, HttpClientHandler, HttpCompletionOption
from System.IO import Path, Directory, File
# keep both: Python zipfile for listing members, and .NET ZipFile for ExtractToDirectory
from zipfile import ZipFile as ZF
from System.IO.Compression import ZipFile
import tarfile
from os import environ
from System import Environment, PlatformID, TimeSpan
from TCAdmin.SDK.Misc.Compression import CompressionTools
from System.Runtime.InteropServices import RuntimeInformation

# Simple WriteLog (replace with ThisTaskStep.WriteLog if that's available in your environment)
def WriteLog(message):
    print(message)

WriteLog("Starting at: " + datetime.now().strftime("%H:%M:%S"))

# Set service to processing
ThisGameService.Variables['Processing'] = "True"
#ThisService.Configure()

java_folder = Path.Combine(ThisService.RootDirectory, 'java')

os = 'windows' if Environment.OSVersion.Platform == PlatformID.Win32NT else 'linux'
arch = 'aarch64' if str(RuntimeInformation.ProcessArchitecture) == 'Arm64' else 'x64'
#WriteLog("Operating system is {0} Architecture is {1}".format(os, arch))

# Should you want to use another API to grab the Java binaries, replace the urls in the following section
java8 = {
    'version': '8',
    'url': 'https://api.adoptium.net/v3/binary/latest/8/ga/{0}/{1}/jdk/hotspot/normal/eclipse?project=jdk'.format(os, arch)
}
java11 = {
    'version': '11',
    'url': 'https://api.adoptium.net/v3/binary/latest/11/ga/{0}/{1}/jdk/hotspot/normal/eclipse?project=jdk'.format(os, arch)
}
java16 = {
    'version': '16',
    'url': 'https://api.adoptium.net/v3/binary/latest/16/ga/{0}/{1}/jdk/hotspot/normal/eclipse?project=jdk'.format(os, arch)
}
java17 = {
    'version': '17',
    'url': 'https://api.adoptium.net/v3/binary/latest/17/ga/{0}/{1}/jdk/hotspot/normal/eclipse?project=jdk'.format(os, arch)
}
java21 = {
    'version': '21',
    'url': 'https://api.adoptium.net/v3/binary/latest/21/ga/{0}/{1}/jdk/hotspot/normal/eclipse?project=jdk'.format(os, arch)
}
urls = [java8, java11, java16, java17, java21]

# Create the java folder if it doesn't exist
if not Directory.Exists(java_folder):
    Directory.CreateDirectory(java_folder)

# Create HttpClientHandler with UseProxy = False.
handler = HttpClientHandler()
handler.UseProxy = False
# defensive: try to clear Proxy object if allowed
try:
    handler.Proxy = None
except Exception:
    pass

client = HttpClient(handler)
# set a User-Agent 
client.DefaultRequestHeaders.TryAddWithoutValidation("User-Agent", "MyApp/1.0 (IronPython)")
# set a reasonable timeout (adjust as needed)
client.Timeout = TimeSpan.FromMinutes(10)

# helper to download a file synchronously (keeps memory footprint moderate by reading bytes once)
def download_file_to_path(url, destination_path):
    resp = client.GetAsync(url, HttpCompletionOption.ResponseHeadersRead).Result
    resp.EnsureSuccessStatusCode()
    # Read all bytes (synchronous style). If you prefer streaming to file, replace with CopyToAsync to a FileStream.
    data = resp.Content.ReadAsByteArrayAsync().Result
    # write bytes to disk
    # ensure parent dir exists
    parent = Path.GetDirectoryName(destination_path)
    if parent and not Directory.Exists(parent):
        Directory.CreateDirectory(parent)
    with open(destination_path, 'wb') as f:
        f.write(data)

try:
    for adoptium in urls:
        # Only download binaries for non-installed versions of Java (environment variables must be set as JAVA8, JAVA11 and JAVA16)
        if 'JAVA{version}'.format(version=adoptium['version']) in environ:
            WriteLog('Skipping downloading ' + adoptium['version'] + ' as env variable exists')
            continue

        # Delete folder if it exists (ie /java/jre16) when we need to update
        target_dir = Path.Combine(java_folder, 'java' + adoptium['version'])
        if Directory.Exists(target_dir):
            Directory.Delete(target_dir, True)
            WriteLog('{} has been deleted before update'.format(Path.Combine('java', 'java' + adoptium['version'])))

        archive_type = '.zip' if Environment.OSVersion.Platform == PlatformID.Win32NT else '.tar.gz'
        archive_name = 'adoptium' + adoptium['version'] + archive_type
        archive_path = Path.Combine(java_folder, archive_name)

        WriteLog('Downloading ' + archive_name)

        # Download archive file
        try:
            download_file_to_path(adoptium['url'], archive_path)
        except Exception as e:
            WriteLog('Something went wrong downloading {}: {}'.format(adoptium['url'], e))
            # skip to next version (don't try to extract)
            continue

        # Extract archive (Windows / zip)
        if archive_name.endswith(".zip"):
            with ZF(archive_path, 'r') as zipObj:
                # In Python 3 use .infolist() (filelist was a Python2 alias)
                foldername = zipObj.infolist()[0].filename
                if Directory.Exists(Path.Combine(java_folder, foldername)):
                    Directory.Delete(Path.Combine(java_folder, foldername), True)
                WriteLog('Extracting ' + archive_name)
                # Use the .NET ZipFile.ExtractToDirectory (already referenced above)
                ZipFile.ExtractToDirectory(archive_path, java_folder)
                WriteLog('All files extracted')
                WriteLog('Renaming directory to ' + Path.Combine('java', 'java' + adoptium['version']))
                Directory.Move(Path.Combine(java_folder, foldername), Path.Combine(java_folder, 'java' + adoptium['version']))

        # Extract archive (Linux / tar.gz)
        elif archive_name.endswith("tar.gz"):
            # We only need tarfile to see the name of the folder in the archive.
            tar = tarfile.open(archive_path, "r:gz")
            try:
                # use getmembers()[0] to get the first member's name (safer and compatible with Python3)
                members = tar.getmembers()
                if not members:
                    raise Exception("Tar archive contains no members")
                foldername = members[0].name
            finally:
                tar.close()

            if Directory.Exists(Path.Combine(java_folder, foldername)):
                Directory.Delete(Path.Combine(java_folder, foldername), True)
            WriteLog('Extracting ' + archive_name)
            # Provide the OS info object to CompressionTools; Environment.OSVersion is a System.OperatingSystem instance
            c = CompressionTools(Environment.OSVersion)
            c.Decompress(archive_path, java_folder)
            WriteLog('All files extracted')
            WriteLog('Renaming directory to ' + Path.Combine(java_folder, 'java' + adoptium['version']))
            Directory.Move(Path.Combine(java_folder, foldername), Path.Combine(java_folder, 'java' + adoptium['version']))

        # Delete archive file
        if File.Exists(archive_path):
            try:
                File.Delete(archive_path)
            except Exception as e:
                WriteLog('Could not delete %s: %s' % (archive_name, e))

# If anything goes wrong, set Processing to False
except Exception as e:
    WriteLog('Something went wrong, aborting: {}'.format(e))
    ThisGameService.Variables['Processing'] = "False"
    #ThisService.Configure()

# Set processing to false
ThisGameService.Variables['Processing'] = "False"
#ThisService.Configure()
WriteLog("Java configuration has finished at " + datetime.now().strftime("%H:%M:%S") + "👍")

script.name: Create executable
script.code:
import clr
from System import Environment, PlatformID
from System.IO import Path
from  platform import system
import os

entrypointMappings = {
    "Java 8": "java8",
    "Java 11": "java11",
    "Java 16": "java16",
}

java_folder = os.path.join(ThisService.RootDirectory, 'java')
executable = '.exe' if system() == 'Windows' else ''
content = ' %*' if system() == 'Windows' else ' $*'
bash_shebang = '#!/bin/bash\n' if system() == 'Linux' else '' #On Linux, we need to add a shebang at the top of the .sh file

if entrypointMappings['Java 16'].upper() in os.environ: #If environment variables exists, use them
  java_path = '\"%'+entrypointMappings['Java 16'].upper()+'%\"' if system() == 'Windows' else '\"${'+entrypointMappings['Java 16'].upper()+'}\"'
elif entrypointMappings['Java 11'].upper() in os.environ:
  java_path = '\"%'+entrypointMappings['Java 11'].upper()+'%\"' if system() == 'Windows' else '\"${'+entrypointMappings['Java 11'].upper()+'}\"'
elif entrypointMappings['Java 8'].upper() in os.environ:
  java_path = '\"%'+entrypointMappings['Java 8'].upper()+'%\"' if system() == 'Windows' else '\"${'+entrypointMappings['Java 8'].upper()+'}\"'
elif os.path.isfile(os.path.join(java_folder, entrypointMappings['Java 16'], 'bin', 'java'+executable)): #If no environment variables exists, check if Java binaries exists on the service
  java_path = os.path.join(java_folder, entrypointMappings['Java 16'], 'bin', 'java'+executable)
elif os.path.isfile(os.path.join(java_folder, entrypointMappings['Java 11'], 'bin', 'java'+executable)):
  java_path = os.path.join(java_folder, entrypointMappings['Java 11'], 'bin', 'java'+executable)
elif os.path.isfile(os.path.join(java_folder, entrypointMappings['Java 8'], 'bin', 'java'+executable)):
  java_path = os.path.join(java_folder, entrypointMappings['Java 8'], 'bin', 'java'+executable)
else: #Fallback to using 'java'
  java_path = 'java'

#Write the java path to the executable file
exe = Path.Combine(ThisService.RootDirectory, ThisService.Executable)
with open(exe, 'w') as file:
  file.write(bash_shebang + java_path + content)

print("Created " + exe)

script.name: Log4jPatcher securing
script.code:
import clr
import json, os, re
clr.AddReference("System")
clr.AddReference("System.Net.Http")   # required for HttpClient types

from System import Version, TimeSpan
from System.Net import ServicePointManager, SecurityProtocolType
from System.Net.Http import HttpClient, HttpClientHandler, HttpCompletionOption

# ensure TLS1.2 (important for GitHub on older .NET versions)
ServicePointManager.SecurityProtocol = SecurityProtocolType.Tls12

# Create an HttpClientHandler with UseProxy = False
handler = HttpClientHandler()
handler.UseProxy = False
# explicitly clear proxy object (defensive)
try:
    handler.Proxy = None
except Exception:
    # some platform/versions may not allow setting Proxy, ignore if so
    pass

# Create HttpClient using the handler
client = HttpClient(handler)
# Add a User-Agent header
client.DefaultRequestHeaders.TryAddWithoutValidation("User-Agent", "MyApp/1.0 (IronPython)")

# Optional: set a reasonable timeout (adjust if you want)
client.Timeout = TimeSpan.FromSeconds(100)

# helper to perform a GET and return the response content as text
def http_get_text(url):
    resp = client.GetAsync(url).Result
    resp.EnsureSuccessStatusCode()
    return resp.Content.ReadAsStringAsync().Result

# helper to download bytes (for files)
def http_get_bytes(url):
    # use ResponseHeadersRead to start streaming once headers are available
    resp = client.GetAsync(url, HttpCompletionOption.ResponseHeadersRead).Result
    resp.EnsureSuccessStatusCode()
    return resp.Content.ReadAsByteArrayAsync().Result

url = 'https://api.github.com/repos/CreeperHost/Log4jPatcher/releases/latest'
json_text = http_get_text(url)
json_info = json.loads(json_text)

# extract a numeric version if the 'name' contains a "v" or other text:
name = json_info.get('name', '')
m = re.search(r'(\d+(?:\.\d+)+)', name)
ver_str = m.group(1) if m else name

try:
    log4jpatcher_version_latest = Version(ver_str)
except Exception:
    # fallback if Version(...) can't parse the string
    log4jpatcher_version_latest = Version('0.0.0')

log4jpatcher_version_installed = Version('0.0.0')  # adjust as needed

if log4jpatcher_version_installed.CompareTo(log4jpatcher_version_latest) < 0:
    print('Service {} - Updating Log4jPatcher before startup'.format(ThisService.ServiceId))
    assets = []  # ensure variable exists even if an exception occurs
    try:
        assets = json_info.get('assets') or []
        if not assets:
            raise Exception('No assets found in release JSON')
        download_url = assets[0]['browser_download_url']

        destination_file = os.path.join(ThisService.RootDirectory, 'Log4jPatcher', 'Log4jPatcher.jar')
        destination_path = os.path.dirname(destination_file)
        if not os.path.exists(destination_path):
            os.makedirs(destination_path)

        # Download file bytes and write to disk
        file_bytes = http_get_bytes(download_url)
        with open(destination_file, 'wb') as f:
            f.write(file_bytes)

        ThisService.Commandline = '-javaagent:Log4jPatcher/Log4jPatcher.jar ' + ThisService.Commandline
        print('Service {} - Log4jPatcher has been updated'.format(ThisService.ServiceId))
        print(ThisService.Commandline)
    except Exception as e:
        asset_name = (assets[0]['name'] if assets else '<unknown>')
        print('Service {} - Failed to download {}: {}'.format(ThisService.ServiceId, asset_name, e))
